definition: to follow/to adhere to/to abide by
step with the left foot (Kangxi radical 60)/see also 彳亍[chi4 chu4]
shield/(currency) Vietnamese dong/currency unit of several countries (Indonesian rupiah, Dutch gulden etc)
to follow/to abide by/to comply with/compliance
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
to follow the compass and go with the set square (idiom); to follow the rules inflexibly/to act according to convention
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
Xunhua Salazu autonomous county in Haidong prefecture 海東地區|海东地区[Hai3 dong1 di4 qu1], Qinghai
to continue the same old routine/to carry on just as before/to procrastinate
Xunhua Salazu autonomous county in Haidong prefecture 海東地區|海东地区[Hai3 dong1 di4 qu1], Qinghai
Xunhua Salazu autonomous county in Haidong prefecture 海東地區|海东地区[Hai3 dong1 di4 qu1], Qinghai
pinyin: Xun2 hua4 Sa3 la1 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 xian4

sentences.english: Attach objects to ropes with figure eight follow through knots.
sentences.chinese: 与图八个对象附加到结绳循。

sentences.english: The hounds followed the stag's scent.
sentences.chinese: 那群猎犬循臭味追寻牡鹿。

sentences.english: There is nothing out of the common course of life in my doing this.
sentences.chinese: 我这么办，循的是人生的常规，毫无出格之处。

sentences.english: Only her eyes could follow the line.
sentences.chinese: 她只能用眼睛去循那条线。

sentences.english: Look what you get, all for a sand fox.
sentences.chinese: 他是循着老沙狐的脚印一步一步找来的。

sentences.english: I beseech Euodias, and beseech Syntyche, that they be of the same mind in the Lord.
sentences.chinese: 我劝友阿爹和循都基，要在主里同心。

sentences.english: As a most often phenomenon of meridian, the phenomenon of perceptual extension is an abnormal sensation, its mechanism is unknown.
sentences.chinese: 是一种循径路走行的异常感觉，机制正在探索中。

sentences.english: So the hound followed the scent and bunted this man.
sentences.chinese: 如此一来猎犬就循着气味搜寻这个人。

sentences.english: Labile cells follow the cell cycle from one mitosis to the next.
sentences.chinese: 不稳定细胞循细胞周期周而复始地进行有丝分裂。

definition: adopted name of Chiang Kai-shek 蔣介石|蒋介石[Jiang3 Jie4 shi2]
to hear suddenly/to learn of sth unexpectedly
small craftsman (contemptuous)/clatter (e.g. of footsteps)/jumbled mass/press of bodies/tumult
